devdoc.author: Chirag Titiya - <chirag@biconomy.io>
devdoc.details: It deploys Smart Accounts as proxies pointing to `basicImplementation` that is immutable.      This allows keeping the same address for the same Smart Account owner on various chains via CREATE2

accountCreationCode().details: Allows to retrieve the creation code used for the Proxy deployment.

returns._0: The creation code for the Proxy.

params.index: extra salt that allows to deploy more account if needed for same EOA (default 0)
extra salt that allows to deploy more accounts if needed for same EOA (default 0)

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: Smart Account Factory - factory responsible for deploying Smart Accounts using CREATE2 and CREATE

deployAccount(address,bytes).notice: Deploys account using create and points it to _implementation

deployCounterFactualAccount(address,byte.notice: Deploys account using create2 and points it to basicImplementation

getAddressForCounterFactualAccount(addre.notice: Allows to find out account address prior to deployment
